    • Constructor Detail

      • MapCanvas

        public MapCanvas(String mapImagePath)
          throws IOException
        Constructs a new MapCanvas object from a map image. The map image can be a .jpg file, a directory containing the map image and its overlays, or a resource path.
        Parameters:
        mapImagePath - - path to the image file, directory or resource.
        Throws:
        IOException

    • Method Detail

      • getMapName

        public String getMapName()
        Gets the name of the map in this MapImage.
        Returns:
        The name of the map.

      • getRoutes

        public Set<String> getRoutes()
        Gets the set of all the routes, given by name, embedded in this map.
        Returns:
        The names of all the routes embedded with this map.
        e.g.: {"AB", "AC", "AD", "BA", "BC", "BD", ...}

      • getOverlays

        public Set<String> getOverlays()
        Gets the set of routes overlaid on the map. This is a subset of all the routes embedded in this map.
        Returns:
        The names of the routes overlayed on the map.
        e.g.: {"AB", "AC", "CB", ...}
        See Also:
        setOverlays(String...), getRoutes()

      • setOverlays

        public void setOverlays(String... routes)
        Sets the routes to be overlaid on the map. This is expected to be a subset of all the routes embedded in this map.
        Parameters:
        routes - - var arg array with the routes to be overlaid on the map.
        See Also:
        getOverlays(), getRoutes()

      • setOverlays

        public void setOverlays(Collection<String> routes)
        Sets the routes to be overlaid on the map. This is expected to be a subset of all the routes embedded in this map.
        Parameters:
        routes - - collection (List, or Set) with the routes to be overlaid on the map.
        See Also:
        getOverlays(), getRoutes()

      • collide

        public boolean collide(String... routes)
        Indicates whether any of the given routes are colliding with any other. A collision is detected if any of the route overlays have non-transparent pixels of different colors at the same coordinates on the map

        Examples:
        assuming "AB" and "AC" have same color, collide("AB", "AC") returns false
        assuming "AB" and "CA" have different colors and have overlapping pixels, collide("AB","CA") returns true.

        Parameters:
        routes - - the list of route names to be tested.
        Returns:
        True if the routes do not collide, false otherwise.

      • setKeyHook

        public void setKeyHook(char key,
                       KeyInterceptor.KeyHook hook)
        Registers a key hook for the given key. The key hook is a lambda function that will be called whenever the key is pressed.
        Parameters:
        key - - the key to be hooked.
        hook - - the lambda function to be called when the key is pressed.

      • getKeyHook

        public KeyInterceptor.KeyHook getKeyHook(char key)
        Gets the key hook registered for the given key.
        Parameters:
        key - - the key for which the hook is requested.
        Returns:
        The key hook registered for the given key.

      • setDemoKeyHooks

        public void setDemoKeyHooks(boolean enable)
        Registers a set of demo key hooks. When enabled, typing the keys corresponding to the route endpoints will cycle through the routes originating at that endpoint and overlay them on the map. Typing 'X' performs a collision test on the overlayed routes.
        Parameters:
        enable - - true to enable the demo key hooks, false to disable.
